thread.title: Trooper performs live-saving measures on driver after crash in Augusta
thread.title_full: Trooper performs live-saving measures on driver after crash in Augusta

author: @WRDW_WAGT
title: Trooper performs live-saving measures on driver after crash in Augusta
text:
Trooper performs live-saving measures on driver after crash in Augusta
AUGUSTA, Ga. (WRDW/WAGT) - A Georgia State Patrol trooper saved a man after a crash in Richmond County early Thursday morning, according to officials.
The Richmond County Sheriff’s Office says deputies responded to a single vehicle collision at 2423 Milledgeville Road at 12:30 a.m.
The crash involved a vehicle that left the roadway and struck the front of the King Wine and Spirits building.
‘Can’t thank her enough’: Georgia teacher saves choking student
A normal day at school turned into a moment of heroism for a Georgia teacher.
GSP Trooper Brandon Crawford also responded to the scene, where he found the driver unresponsive and not breathing.
Crawford immediately administered Narcan and began CPR, according to deputies.
The driver became alert but irritated, which deputies say is consistent with symptoms observed during overdose reversals.
The driver sustained minor injuries from the collision due to the impact, officials say.
Local children’s hospital welcomes 1st male facility dog
Wellstar Golisano Children’s Hospital of Georgia is welcoming a new facility dog.
According to deputies, the driver was transported to AUMC Wellstar for treatment and is expected to make a full recovery.
“We are blessed to have many Georgia State Patrol troopers working within our area and regularly augmenting the Richmond County Sheriff’s Office Traffic Division. Troopers are highly trained professionals who work diligently to help keep drivers in our community safe. Trooper Crawford did a great job today and we are proud of his service within our area,” said Chief Lewis Blanchard with the Richmond County Sheriff’s Office.
Deputies say Crawford’s actions directly contributed to saving the driver’s life.
